intro: Cliffortia heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf cliffortia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its variable leaf morphology, which can range from linear to ovate in shape. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found growing on slopes or cliffs. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is cultivated in gardens in regions with a Mediterranean climate.
